Question: In an AP-AOL "Black Voices" poll in February 2006, this person was voted "the most important black leader".
Hints: This person's influence extended to international matters in the 1980s and 1990s.
After the students were expelled, this person spoke out arguing that the expulsions were unfair and racially biased.
In March 2007, this person declared his support for then-Senator Barack Obama in the 2008 democratic primaries.
